name: File
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File
description:
File

Represents a File (Object) that belongs to a Bucket. Files (Objects) are the individual pieces of data that you store in Google Cloud Storage. A file can be up to 5 TB in size. Files have two components: data and metadata. The data component is the data from an external file or other data source that you want to store in Google Cloud Storage. The metadata component is a collection of name-value pairs that describe various qualities of the data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.download "path/to/downloaded/file.ext"

methods.name: kind
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#kind
methods.description: The kind of item this is. For files, this is always storage#object.

title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#id
methods.description: The ID of the file.

title: Google

File#name

title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#bucket

methods.name: generation
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#generation
methods.description: The content generation of this file. Used for object versioning.

methods.name: metageneration
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#metageneration
methods.description: The version of the metadata for this file at this generation. Used for preconditions and for detecting changes in metadata. A metageneration number is only meaningful in the context of a particular generation of a particular file.

Cloud
Storage
File#api_url
methods.description: A URL that can be used to access the file using the REST API.

methods.name: media_url
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#media_url
methods.description: A URL that can be used to download the file using the REST API.

methods.name: size
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#size
methods.description: Content-Length of the data in bytes.

title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#created_at
methods.description: Creation time of the file.

methods.name: updated_at
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#updated_at
methods.description: The creation or modification time of the file. For buckets with versioning enabled, changing an objectâ€™s metadata does not change this property.

methods.name: md5
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#md5
methods.description: MD5 hash of the data; encoded using base64.

methods.name: crc32c
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#crc32c
methods.description: The CRC32c checksum of the data, as described in RFC 4960, Appendix B. Encoded using base64 in big-endian byte order.

File#etag
methods.description: HTTP 1.1 Entity tag for the file.

Storage

Cloud
Storage
File#content_encoding
methods.description: The Content-Encoding of the file data.

methods.name: metadata
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#metadata
methods.description: A hash of custom, user-provided web-safe keys and arbitrary string values that will returned with requests for the file as â€œx-goog-meta-â€œ response headers.

methods.name: metadata=
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#metadata=
methods.description: Updates the hash of custom, user-provided web-safe keys and arbitrary string values that will returned with requests for the file as â€œx-goog-meta-â€œ response headers.

methods.name: encryption_key_sha256
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#encryption_key_sha256
methods.description: An RFC 4648 Base64-encoded string of the SHA256 hash of the customer-supplied encryption key. You can use this SHA256 hash to uniquely identify the AES-256 encryption key required to decrypt this file.

methods.name: storage_class
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#storage_class
methods.description: The fileâ€™s storage class. This defines how the file is stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. For more information, see Storage Classes and Per-Object Storage Class.

methods.name: storage_class=
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#storage_class=
methods.description: Updates how the file is stored and determines the SLA and the cost of storage. Values include :multi_regional, :regional, :nearline, :coldline, :standard, and :dra (Durable Reduced Availability), as well as the strings returned by File#storage_class or Bucket#storage_class. For more information, see Storage Classes and Per-Object Storage Class. The default value is the default storage class for the bucket. See Bucket#storage_class.

params.name: storage_class
params.description: Storage class of the file.

methods.name: update
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#update
methods.description: Updates the file with changes made in the given block in a single PATCH request. The following attributes may be set: #cache_control=, #content_disposition=, #content_encoding=, #content_language=, #content_type=, and #metadata=. The #metadata hash accessible in the block is completely mutable and will be included in the request.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"

file.update do |f|
  f.cache_control = "private, max-age=0, no-cache"
  f.content_disposition = "inline; filename=filename.ext"
  f.content_encoding = "deflate"
  f.content_language = "de"
  f.content_type = "application/json"
  f.metadata["player"] = "Bob"
  f.metadata["score"] = "10"
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a delegate object for updating the file

methods.name: download
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#download
methods.description:
Download the fileâ€™s contents to a local file or an IO instance.

By default, the download is verified by calculating the MD5 digest.

If a customer-supplied encryption key was used with Bucket#create_file, the encryption_key option must be provided.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.download "path/to/downloaded/file.ext"

examples.caption: Use the CRC32c digest by passing :crc32c.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.download "path/to/downloaded/file.ext", verify: :crc32c

examples.caption: Use the MD5 and CRC32c digests by passing :all.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.download "path/to/downloaded/file.ext", verify: :all

examples.caption: Disable the download verification by passing :none.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.download "path/to/downloaded/file.ext", verify: :none

examples.caption: Download to an in-memory StringIO object.
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
downloaded = file.download
downloaded.rewind
downloaded.read #=> "Hello world!"

params.name: path
params.description:
The path on the local file system to write
the data to. The path provided must be writable. Can also be an IO
object, or IO-ish object like StringIO. If an IO object, the object
will be written to, not the filesystem. If omitted, a new StringIO
instance will be written to and returned. Optional.

params.name: verify
params.description:
The verification algorithm used to ensure the downloaded file contents are correct. Default is :md5.

Acceptable values are:

  • md5 - Verify file content match using the MD5 hash.
  • crc32c - Verify file content match using the CRC32c hash.
  • all - Perform all available file content verification.
  • none - Donâ€™t perform file content verification.

params.name: encryption_key
params.description: Optional. The customer-supplied, AES-256 encryption key used to encrypt the file, if one was provided to Bucket#create_file.

returns.description: Returns an IO object representing the file data. This will ordinarily be a ::File object referencing the local file system. However, if the argument to path is nil, a StringIO instance will be returned. If the argument to path is an IO object, then that object will be returned.

methods.name: copy
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#copy
methods.description:
Copy the file to a new location.

If a customer-supplied encryption key was used with Bucket#create_file, the encryption_key option must be provided.

examples.caption: The file can be copied to a new path in the current bucket:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.copy "path/to/destination/file.ext"

examples.caption: The file can also be copied to a different bucket:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.copy "new-destination-bucket",
          "path/to/destination/file.ext"

examples.caption: The file can also be copied by specifying a generation:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.copy "copy/of/previous/generation/file.ext",
          generation: 123456

params.name: dest_bucket_or_path
params.description:
Either the bucket to copy the file
to, or the path to copy the file to in the current bucket.

params.name: dest_path
params.description:
If a bucket was provided in the first
parameter, this contains the path to copy the file to in the given
bucket.

params.name: acl
params.description:
A predefined set of access controls to apply to new file.

Acceptable values are:

  • auth, auth_read, authenticated, authenticated_read, authenticatedRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allAuthenticatedUsers get READER access.
  • owner_full, bucketOwnerFullControl - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get OWNER access.
  • owner_read, bucketOwnerRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team owners get READER access.
  • private - File owner gets OWNER access.
  • project_private, projectPrivate - File owner gets OWNER access, and project team members get access according to their roles.
  • public, public_read, publicRead - File owner gets OWNER access, and allUsers get READER access.

params.name: generation
params.description:
Select a specific revision of the file to
copy. The default is the latest version.

params.name: encryption_key
params.description: Optional. The customer-supplied, AES-256 encryption key used to encrypt the file, if one was provided to Bucket#create_file.

methods.name: rotate
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#rotate
methods.description:
Rewrites the file to the same #bucket and #name with a new customer-supplied encryption key.

If a new key is provided to this method, the new key must be used to subsequently download or copy the file. You must securely manage your keys and ensure that they are not lost. Also, please note that file metadata is not encrypted, with the exception of the CRC32C checksum and MD5 hash. The names of files and buckets are also not encrypted, and you can read or update the metadata of an encrypted file without providing the encryption key.

examples.caption: The file will be rewritten with a new encryption key:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new
bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

# Old key was stored securely for later use.
old_key = "y\x03\"\x0E\xB6\xD3\x9B\x0E\xAB*\x19\xFAv\xDEY\xBEI..."

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext", encryption_key: old_key

# Key generation shown for example purposes only. Write your own.
cipher = OpenSSL::Cipher.new "aes-256-cfb"
cipher.encrypt
new_key = cipher.random_key

file.rotate encryption_key: old_key, new_encryption_key: new_key

params.name: encryption_key
params.description:
Optional. The last
customer-supplied, AES-256 encryption key used to encrypt the file,
if one was used.

params.name: new_encryption_key
params.description: Optional. The new customer-supplied, AES-256 encryption key with which to encrypt the file. If nil, the rewritten file will be encrypted using the default server-side encryption, not customer-supplied encryption keys.

methods.name: delete
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#delete
methods.description: Permanently deletes the file.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-bucket"

file = bucket.file "path/to/my-file.ext"
file.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the file was deleted.

methods.name: public_url
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#public_url
methods.description: Public URL to access the file. If the file is not public, requests to the URL will return an error. (See File::Acl#public! and Bucket::DefaultAcl#public!) To share a file that is not public see #signed_url.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
public_url = file.public_url

examples.caption: Generate the URL with a protocol other than HTTPS:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
public_url = file.public_url protocol: "http"

params.name: protocol
params.description: The protocol to use for the URL. Default is HTTPS.

methods.name: signed_url
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#signed_url
methods.description:
Access without authentication can be granted to a File for a specified period of time. This URL uses a cryptographic signature of your credentials to access the file.

Generating a URL requires service account credentials, either by connecting with a service account when calling Google::Cloud.storage, or by passing in the service account issuer and signing_key values. Although the private key can be passed as a string for convenience, creating and storing an instance of OpenSSL::PKey::RSA is more efficient when making multiple calls to signed_url.

A SignedUrlUnavailable is raised if the service account credentials are missing. Service account credentials are acquired by following the steps in Service Account Authentication.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
shared_url = file.signed_url

examples.caption: Any of the option parameters may be specified:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
shared_url = file.signed_url method: "PUT",
                             content_type: "image/png",
                             expires: 300 # 5 minutes from now

examples.caption: Using the issuer and signing_key options:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
key = OpenSSL::PKey::RSA.new "-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----\n..."
shared_url = file.signed_url issuer: "service-account@gcloud.com",
                             signing_key: key

examples.caption: Using the headers option:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"
shared_url = file.signed_url method: "GET",
                             headers: {
                               "x-goog-acl" => "public-read",
                               "x-goog-meta-foo" => "bar,baz"
                             }

params.name: method
params.description: The HTTP verb to be used with the signed URL. Signed URLs can be used with GET, HEAD, PUT, and DELETE requests. Default is GET.

params.name: expires
params.description:
The number of seconds until the URL expires.
Default is 300/5 minutes.

params.name: content_type
params.description: When provided, the client (browser) must send this value in the HTTP header. e.g. text/plain

params.name: content_md5
params.description:
The MD5 digest value in base64. If you
provide this in the string, the client (usually a browser) must
provide this HTTP header with this same value in its request.

params.name: headers
params.description: Google extension headers (custom HTTP headers that begin with x-goog-) that must be included in requests that use the signed URL.

params.name: issuer
params.description: Service Accountâ€™s Client Email.

params.name: client_email
params.description: Service Accountâ€™s Client Email.

params.name: signing_key
params.description:
Service Accountâ€™s
Private Key.

params.name: private_key
params.description:
Service Accountâ€™s
Private Key.

methods.name: acl
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#acl
methods.description:
The File::Acl instance used to control access to the file.

A file has owners, writers, and readers. Permissions can be granted to an individual userâ€™s email address, a groupâ€™s email address, as well as many predefined lists.

examples.caption: Grant access to a user by prepending "user-" to an email:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"

email = "heidi@example.net"
file.acl.add_reader "user-#{email}"

examples.caption: Grant access to a group by prepending "group-" to an email:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"

email = "authors@example.net"
file.acl.add_reader "group-#{email}"

examples.caption: Or, grant access via a predefined permissions list:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/storage"

storage = Google::Cloud::Storage.new

bucket = storage.bucket "my-todo-app"
file = bucket.file "avatars/heidi/400x400.png"

file.acl.public!

methods.name: reload!
title: Google
Cloud
Storage
File#reload!
methods.description: Reloads the file with current data from the Storage service.
